intro: Cochemiea dioica, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It has a succulent structure, allowing it to store water and survive in dry conditions. Cochemiea dioica is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
